alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 5:44PM EST until February 27 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Rutland County in southern Vermont... Southern Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 630 PM EST. * At 542 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of East Thetford to near West Pawlet, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. Multiple videos have confirmed whiteout conditions within this snow squall. Observed wind gusts of up to 40 MPH have been reported by ASOS and mesonet. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 91 between mile markers 39 and 72. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Chester, White River Junction, Hartland Four Corners, Cavendish, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Plymouth, Hartland, Wells, Windsor, Pawlet, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Andover, Mount Tabor and Weston. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
